intro: Matelea scopulorum, commonly known as the rock matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody, shrub-like structure and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
